sentences.english: Blond - haired blue - eyed Westerners also come for a look-see .
sentences.chinese: 金发碧眼的洋人也来探个究竟。

sentences.english: Manufacturing the highest cost-performance die casting machine is our eternal pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 制造“最具性价比的压铸机”是宝洋人永恒的追求。

sentences.english: In the same way, Chiang hated foreigners even while he depended on them.
sentences.chinese: 同样，蒋尽管依赖洋人，却也憎恨洋人。

sentences.english: In the same way, Chiang hated foreigners even while he depended on them.
sentences.chinese: 同样，蒋尽管依赖洋人，却也憎恨洋人。

sentences.english: Zaiyi advised to kill the foreigners and fight against the foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 主张杀洋人，杀教民，与外国开战。

sentences.english: Have you ever heard a foreign street?
sentences.chinese: 你知道桂林有个洋人街吗？

sentences.english: Fine food being able to how many countries to be arrived at in Chongqing foreigner street?
sentences.chinese: 在重庆洋人街能吃到多少个国家的美食？

sentences.english: The Boxers replied, ‘We don’t want money. We want the foreigners’ heads’.
sentences.chinese: 拳民回道，‘我们不要钱，我们要洋人的头’”。

definition: foreign devil/term of abuse for Westerners
foreign religion (esp. Western Christianity in Qing China)
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
the Qing court (as government of China)
Eight-Nation Alliance, involved in a military intervention in northern China in 1900
the Righteous and Harmonious Fists/the Boxers (history)
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
foreign concession, an enclave occupied by a foreign power (in China in the 19th and 20th centuries)
the Qing dynasty equivalent of the Foreign Office
